Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one of the issues of being totally decentralized is the problem of how to detect a malicious peer

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://cointelegraph.com/news/electrum-faces-another-fake-wallet-attack-users-reported-to-lose-millions-of-dollars

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in PoW mining this is sidestepped by just defining that the one with most hashrate is the real chain, but it doesnt work so well in other cases unless it is very very carefully designed

Content: mm1 didnt have any electrum support intended

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: after it was working, electrum support was added, but of course it wasnt exactly designed in

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it depends on reliable electrum servers, but they disconnect after 10 errors. cipi modified it to wait until 1000 errors

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the fact that via cli it works much better indicates the issue is electrum

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so having a gui that uses the mode that is less reliable.... give us the choice of easier to user gui with less reliable electrum, or harder to use barterDEX gui with native
